radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is moderately distended with three large gallstones (up to 2.2 cm), one likely impacted. Gallbladder wall edema and small pericholecystic fluid noted. Mild hepatic hyperemia observed. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. Normal pancreatic duct and liver parenchyma; simple cysts in the liver; no worrisome focal lesions. Normal spleen, kidneys, adrenal glands, bowel, and grossly unremarkable abdominal aorta and stomach.
